commit.message: beginning to integrate postgres with multiuser settings to be used with central repository
changes in multi user settings are redirected to central repository
beginning to create settings choice vs. db choice
working through refactoring postgres settings in central repo
updates for creating db if does not exist
updates of gui and codacy items
fixes to address comments in central repo and multi user coordination

If the second string is displayed in the UI, it should be in a bundle message

nodes.bodyText: Should we do more than just log an error if these parameters are invalid? There may be empty fields in the settings object. If this is what we want to do, add a comment that this is what's happening.
This could use a comment and a more descriptive name. As it stands, logException() would be more accurate.
In the previous section this is a warning and the default password is used. Why is it different here? Also if the error is "SEVERE" we probably shouldn't just log it and continue on.
These names could be a bit more descriptive.

nodes.bodyText: Why is this in this PR?
I don't think you named this, but an underscore would really help readability for "TESTEDOK"
